quotes.quote: Worry is an addiction that interferes with compassion.
Rule number one is, don't sweat the small stuff. Rule number two is, it's all small stuff.
If worrying were an Olympic sport, you'd get the gold for sure.
We are anxious in the face of our unchangeable past; we long to recreate segments of our private histories, but we are stuck with them.
If you want to conquer the anxiety of life, live in the moment, live in the breath.
Anxiety is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged, it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
Anxiety is the handmaiden of contemporary ambition.
The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
Anxiety's like a rocking chair. It gives you something to do, but it doesn't get you very far.
Don't be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams.
What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
Worry ducks when purpose flies overhead.
Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
A pleasure a day keeps stress away.
The desire to annoy no one, to harm no one, can equally well be the sign of a just as of an anxious disposition.
When thinking about life, remember this; No amount of guilt can solve the past and no amount of anxiety or worry can change the future.
Trust yourself. You've survived a lot, and you'll survive whatever is coming.
Do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Let the day's own trouble be sufficient for the day.
Whoever has learned to be anxious in the right way has learned the ultimate.
Keep walking through the storm. Your rainbow is waiting on the other side.
Worry, doubt, fear and despair are the enemies which slowly bring us down to the ground and turn us to dust before we die.
Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.
You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
A negative mind will never give a positive life.
Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
Unexpected kindness is the most powerful, least costly, and most underrated agent of human change.
The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
Worrying is like sitting in a rocking chair. It gives you something to do, but it doesn't get you anywhere.
Worry trades the joy of now for the unlikely catastrophes of later.
